headline: How Vesuvius Claimed Victims
abstract: Two studies examined grim scenes left at a Roman settlement devastated by the 79 A.D. eruption.
lead_paragraph: The infants and children huddled in the stone boathouses. The women pressed in next to them. The men crowded in last. Theyâ€™d all fled Herculaneum on August 24, 79 A.D. as Mount Vesuvius rained destruction on the city, as it did Pompeii and other Roman settlements near the Bay of Naples.
